snippet: While the report was upbeat, with a survey finding a big increase in the number of people who found a job last month, wage growth continued to drag.
abstract: Labor Dept issues employment report that provides fresh evidence that economy is getting better, with sizable jump in number of people saying they found job in October; department estimates that employers added 214,000 in the month, and official unemployment rate dropped to 5.8 percent, down sharply from 7.2 percent year ago.

byline.contributor: Binyamin Appelbaum contributed reporting from Washington and Liz Alderman from Paris.

lead_paragraph: While the report was upbeat, with a survey finding a big increase in the number of people who found a job last month, wage growth continued to drag.

headline.main: Jobs Data Show Steady Gains, but Stagnant Wages Temper Optimism
headline.print_headline: Jobs Data Show Steady Gains, but Stagnant Wages Temper Optimism
